clinical_study.brief_title: Use of Metabolomics to Differentiate the Antihypertensive Effect of Acupuncture From Sham Acupuncture in Hypertensives
clinical_study.official_title: Use of Metabolomics to Differentiate the Antihypertensive Effect of Acupuncture From Sham Acupuncture in Hypertensives

collaborator.agency: Chengdu University of Traditional Chinese Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the effect of acupuncture versus sham acupuncture on regulating the targeted metabolome of hypertensive patients.

detailed_description.textblock: Acupuncture has been widely used for blood pressure management. Its effect on the cardiovascular-related targeted metabolome is still unknown. This pilot study aimed to assess the effect of acupuncture versus sham acupuncture on regulating the targeted metabolome of hypertensive patients.

arm_group.description: Use real acupuncture treatment for blood pressure management in patients with hypertension
Use non-acupoint as the stimulating site in acupuncture for the treatment of hypertension

intervention.description: Stimulate acupoint with filiform needles to restore the healthy condition of patients
Stimulate non-acupoint with filiform needles to treat the condition of patients

overall_official.affiliation: Chengdu University of Traditional Chinese Medicine
